sen.j: 祝園駅（ほうそのえき）は、京都府相楽郡精華町大字祝園小字長塚にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）片町線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Koaza-Nagatsuka, Oaza-Hosono, Seikacho, Sorakugun of Kyoto Prefecture, Hosono Station is a stop on the Katamachi Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Hosono Station, located in Koaza-Nagatsuka, Oaza-Hosono, Seikacho, Sorakugun of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Hosono Station, located in Koaza-Nagatsuka, Oaza-Hosono, Seika-cho, Sorakugun of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 難読駅名のひとつ。
sen.e: It is one the station names difficult to read correctly in Japanese.
It is one the station names that is difficult to read correctly in Japanese.
It is one the station names that is difficult to read correctly in Japanese.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線ホームを持つ橋上駅。
sen.e: It is an above-track station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.
It is an above-track station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.
It is an above-track station with two platforms opposite each other and two tracks.

sen.j: ホーム長は4両分しかないが、2010年3月（2009年度末）をめどに当駅を含めた木津駅～同志社前駅間のホームが7両対応に延伸される予定である。
sen.e: Platform length can accommodate only four cars, but platforms of stations between Kizu and Doshisha-mae including this station are scheduled to be extended to accommodate seven cars by March 2010 (end fiscal 2009.)

The platform length can accommodate only four cars, but the platforms of stations between Kizu and Doshisha-mae (including this station) are scheduled to be extended to accommodate seven cars by March 2010 (end of fiscal 2009).

The platform length can accommodate only four cars, but the platforms of stations between Kizu and Doshisha-mae (including this station) are scheduled to be extended to accommodate seven cars by March 2010 (end of fiscal year 2009).

sen.j: 一線スルー化されておらずY字分岐であるため、発着ホームは方向別で完全に分けられている。
sen.e: Departing and/or arriving platform is completely segregated by the direction trains are to move as a one track thoroughfare setup is not in place and from Y figuration branching,.

The platforms for departures and arrivals are completely segregated by the directions in which trains are to move, because a one-track thoroughfare setup is not in place and also due to the Y-configuration branching,.

The platforms for departures and arrivals are completely segregated by the directions in which trains are to move, because a one-track thoroughfare setup is not in place and due to the Y-configuration branching.

sen.j: 近鉄京都線の新祝園駅とは改札外の橋上通路で結ばれている。
sen.e: Connected to Kintetsu Kyoto Line Shin-Hosono Station outside ticket gates by an above-track corridor.
It is connected to Kintetsu Kyoto Line Shin-Hosono Station outside the ticket gates by an above-track corridor.
It is connected to Kintetsu Kyoto Line Shin-Hosono Station outside the ticket gates by an above-track corridor.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみで、自動改札機は簡易改札タイプになっている。
sen.e: Wicket exists at only one place and automated ticket gates are of simplified type.
A wicket is found in only one place, and the automated ticket gates are of the simplified type.
A wicket is found in only one place, and the automated ticket gates are of the simplified type.

sen.j: なお、当駅はジェイアール西日本交通サービスが業務を行う業務委託駅となっている。
sen.e: Station operations are commissioned to JW-WestJapan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JW-WestJapan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルーが利用可能。
sen.e: ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used.
ICOCA and J Through cards can be used.
The ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used.

sen.j: Jスルーカードについては、簡易改札機による対応のため複数枚の処理不可。
sen.e: As ticket gates are of simplified type, J Through Cards can be dealt with only when used one at a time.
sen.cmt: 現状に則していない記述と思います。
sen.e: Because the ticket gates are of simplified type, the J Through cards can be handled only when used one at a time.
The simple-type automated ticket gates can't handle the use of more than one J-Thru Card for a single transaction.
sen.cmt: 既出の記事の表現と統一

sen.j: ※案内上ののりば番号は設定されていない（自動放送では大阪環状線・桜井線・和歌山線の駅のように「このホームに」という表現がなされている）。
sen.e: ※Track or platform number of the train on which one is to board is not shown on direction boards (automated announcements refer to 'this platform' similar to that on Osaka Loop Line, Sakurai Line and Wakayama Line.)

※The track or platform number of the train on which one is to board is not shown on the direction boards (automated announcements refer to 'this platform,' in a manner similar to those on the Osaka Loop, Sakurai and Wakayama lines).

※The track or platform number of the train on which one is to board is not shown on the direction boards (automated announcements refer to 'this platform,' in a manner similar to those on the Osaka Loop, Sakurai and Wakayama lines).

sen.j: 新祝園駅 - 近鉄京都線との乗換駅である。
sen.e: Shin-Hosono Station - The station at which to transfer to/from Kintetsu Kyoto Line.
Shin-Hosono Station - The station for transfer to/from the Kintetsu Kyoto Line
Shin-Hosono Station - The station for transfer to/from the Kintetsu Kyoto Line

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約1,762人である。
sen.e: Passengers getting on at this station was approximately 1,762 per day in fiscal 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）6月4日 関西鉄道長尾駅 (大阪府)～新木津（廃止）間延伸により開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated June 4, 1898 as the section between Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture) and Shin-Kizu Station (abolished) on Kansei Railway's Line was extended.
It was inaugurated June 4, 1898 as the section between Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture) and Shin-Kizu Station (abolished) on Kansei Railway's Line was extended.
June 4, 1898: The station was inaugurated as the section between Nagao Station (Osaka Prefecture) and Shin-Kizu Station (abolished) when Kansai Railway's Line was extended.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: 原文のままでは読めないので加筆修正しました。
sen.e: The Kansei Railway Company was nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
October 1, 1907: The Kansai Railway Company was nationalized under the Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 as a result of split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 as a result of the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）9月14日 橋上駅となり、近鉄新祝園駅との連絡橋完成。
sen.e: Became an above-track station on Sept.14, 1994 and connecting bridge to Kintetsu Shin-Hosono Station completed,
It became an above-track station on Sept.14, 1994, and the connecting bridge to Kintetsu Shin-Hosono Station completed,
September 14, 1994: The station became an above-track station, and the connecting bridge to Kintetsu Shin-Hosono Station was completed.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）2月2日 みどりの窓口営業開始。
sen.e: JR Ticket Office (Midori-no-madoguchi) opened for business on Feb. 2, 2007.
The JR ticket office (Midori-no-madoguchi) opened for business on Feb. 2, 2007.
February 2, 2007: The JR Ticket Office (Midori-no-madoguchi) opened for business.
